questionList.qu: Non-profit organizations that support good causes
questionList.solution: A charity is a non-profit organization that provides support for good causes such as environmental protection

questionList.qu: What is a company/corporation?
questionList.a2: A business owned by the government
questionList.solution: A company (or corporation) is a business that is owned by shareholders

questionList.qu: Part of the economy run by private individuals and businesses
questionList.solution: The private sector is the part of the economy that is run by private individuals and businesses instead of the governemnt

questionList.qu: Part of the economy controlled by the government
questionList.solution: The public sector is the part of the economy that is run by the government instead of private individuals and businesses

questionList.qu: Sole Trader
questionList.a2: Self-employed person who runs the business and responsiable for it
questionList.a3: A business that only deals with one organization
questionList.a4: A business that only works within the private sector
questionList.solution: A sole trader is a self-employed person who runs and controls the business and responsiable for its success or failure

questionList.qu: For-profit social enterprises set up, owned and run by their members.
questionList.solution: Cooperatives are for-profit social enterprises that are set up, owned and run by their members who can be employees and/or customers.

questionList.qu: Type of financial service aimed at small business entrepreneurs
questionList.solution: Microfiancing is a type of financial service aimed at small business entrepreneurs especially females and low incomes

questionList.qu: Type of business in the private sector owned by 2-20 people
questionList.solution: A partnership is a type of business in the private sector owned by 2-20 people who share the responsibilities of the business

questionList.qu: Stock Exchange
questionList.a1: A virtual marketplace for digital currency
questionList.a2: Governement operated section of the economy
questionList.a3: A subcategory of the private sector
questionList.a4: A marketplace for trading stocks and shares of public limited companies
questionList.solution: The stock exchange is a marketplace for trading stocks and shares of public limited companies

questionList.qu: Organizations fully owned by the gorvenment
questionList.solution: Organizations fully owned by the gorvenment are known as state-owned enterprises

questionList.qu: Incorporated businesses that allows the public to buy and sell shares in the company via a stock exchange
questionList.solution: Public limited companies are incorporated businesses that allows the public to buy and sell shares in the company via a stock exchange

questionList.qu: Define Public-private partnerships
questionList.a1: When a cooperative works with a limited company
questionList.a2: When a state-owned enterprise works with a company
questionList.a3: When the governenment works together with the private sector
questionList.a4: When an incorporation works with social enterprises
questionList.solution: A Public-private partnership occurs when the governenment works together with the private sector

questionList.qu: Revenue-generating business with social objectives at the core of their operations
questionList.solution: Social enterprises are revenue-generating business with social objectives at the core of their operations

questionList.qu: Restriction on the amount of money that owners can lose is their business goes bankrupt
questionList.solution: Limited Liability is a restriction on the amount of money that owners can lose is their business goes bankrupt

questionList.qu: Business owned by shareholders with limited liability and shares cannot be traded
questionList.solution: A private limited company is a business owned by shareholders with limited liability and shares that cannot be sold or bought by the general public

questionList.qu: Define Initial Public Offering
questionList.a1: The process of a private business converting to a public business
questionList.a2: When a business sells shares of the business on the stock market for the first time
questionList.a3: When a business sells the company to the government
questionList.a4: The process of making a business public and accessable to the public for the first time
questionList.solution: Initial Public Offering (IPO) occurs when a business sells all or part of the business to shareholders on the stock market

questionList.qu: Legal contract signed by owners of a partnership
questionList.solution: A deep of partnership is a legal contract signed by owners of a partnership

questionList.qu: Private sector not-for-profit social enterprises operating for the benefit of others
questionList.solution: A non-governmental organizations (NGO) are private sector not-for-profit social enterprises operating for the benefit of others rather than to make profit

questionList.qu: Type of business where there is a legal difference between the owners of the company and the business itself
questionList.solution: Incorporation means that there is a legal difference between the owners of the company and the business itself

questionList.qu: Feature of sole traders and ordinary partnerships who are legally liable for all for all money owed
questionList.solution: Unlimited liability is a feature of sole traders and ordinary partnerships who are legally liable for all for all money owed even if it means selling personal possessions to pay for their debts
